oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PHYSICAL MODELING OF SAND LIQUEFACTION UNDER WAVE BREAKING ON A VERTICAL WALL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Michallet, Herv√©
Rameliarison, Valerie
Berni, Celine
Bergonzoli, Maxime
Barnoud, Jean-Marc
Barthelemy, Eric
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: soil fluidization
pore pressure
momentary liquefaction
gas content
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The wave induced liquefaction at a coastal structure is studied. Experiments in a glass-wall flume filled with a partially saturated bed of light-weight sediment are presented. Single wave loadings are simulated. For large enough wave height conditions an excess pore pressure is recorded within the soil and a liquefaction threshold is reached. Velocity fields obtained from video recordings display large zones of the bed that behave as a fluid. Phases of soil compaction and dilatancy are identified.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; structures.78
